fields.label: organism part
fields.description: The part of organism's anatomy or substance arising from an organism from which the biomaterial was derived, excludes cells.

fields.label: lifestage
fields.description: the age class or life stage of the organism at the time of collection.

fields.label: project name
fields.description: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

fields.label: tolid
fields.description: A ToLID (Tree of Life ID) is a unique and easy to communicate sample identifier that provides species recognition, differentiates between specimen of the same species and adds taxonomic context. ToLIDs are endorsed by the EarthBioGenome Project (EBP) and should be assigned to any sample with association to the EBP. More information at id.tol.sanger.ac.uk.

fields.label: barcoding center
fields.description: Center where DNA barcoding was/will be performed.

fields.label: collected by
fields.description: name of persons or institute who collected the specimen

fields.label: collector ORCID ID
fields.description: Enter the 16 digits ORCID ID of the person or people who is responsible for the genome project of the sample

fields.label: date of collection
fields.description: The date of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

fields.label: time of collection
fields.description: Time of day of sample collection in 24-hour clock format, with hours and minutes separated by colon e.g., 13:35, 04:53, etc. This should be in GMT/UTC. This field may be particularly relevant for RNAseq

fields.label: description of collection method
fields.description: A detailed as possible description of the sample collection methods, e.g., “caught with fibre net within densely wooded area, and immediately placed into the collection container

fields.label: geographic location (country and/or sea)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country or sea. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).
options: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

fields.label: geographic location (region and locality)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

fields.label: geographic location (latitude)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

fields.label: geographic location (longitude)
fields.description: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude and longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

fields.label: grid reference
fields.description: Information to geolocate the sample area, preferably with a map or standardised geolocation reference, e.g., OS GRID REF: SP45998 08751. https://osmaps.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/ is useful to map lat-long to grid references

fields.label: identified by
fields.description: name of the expert who identified the specimen taxonomically

fields.label: identified how
fields.description: Indicate what method(s) were used to identify the specimen to the nominal species (e.g., morphology, ITS barcoding)

fields.label: geographic location (depth)
fields.description: Depth is defined as the vertical distance below surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectivly. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

fields.label: geographic location (elevation)
fields.description: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

fields.label: habitat
fields.description: description of the location of the sample material. please use EnvO terms where possible: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/envo

fields.label: identifier affiliation
fields.description: the university, institution, or society responsible for identifying the specimen.

fields.label: original collection date
fields.description: For use if the specimen is from a zoo, botanic garden, culture collection etc. and has a known original date of collection. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

fields.label: original geographic location
fields.description: For use if the specimen is from a zoo, botanic garden or culture collection etc. and has a known origin elsewhere. Please record the general description of the original collection location. This should be formatted as a country and optionally include more specific locations ranging from least to most specific separated by a | character, e.g. 'United Kingdom | East Anglia | Norfolk | Norwich | University of East Anglia | UEA Broad'.

fields.label: sample derived from
fields.description: Reference to parental sample(s) or original run(s) that the assembly is derived from. The referenced samples or runs should already be registered in INSDC. This should be formatted as one of the following. A single sample/run e.g. ERSxxxxxx OR a comma separated list e.g. ERSxxxxxx,ERSxxxxxx OR a range e.g. ERSxxxxxx-ERSxxxxxx

fields.label: sample same as
fields.description: Reference to sample(s) that are equivalent. The referenced sample(s) should already be registered in INSDC. This should be formatted as one of the following. A single sample e.g. ERSxxxxxx OR a comma separated list e.g. ERSxxxxxx,ERSxxxxxx

fields.label: sample symbiont of
fields.description: Reference to host sample from symbiont. The referenced sample should already be registered in INSDC. E.g. ERSxxxxxx

fields.label: sample coordinator orcid id
fields.description: Enter the 16 digits ORCID ID of the person or people who is responsible for the genome project of the sample

fields.label: preserved by
fields.description: Name of person that carried out the preservation, supplied in CAPITALS. Multiple preserver names should be separated by a | character

fields.label: preservative_solution
fields.description: Suspension liquid used to preserve the sample, e.g., RNALater, RLT Buffer, DESS

fields.label: barcode plate preservative
fields.description: Typically, animal samples will be submerged in 70% ethanol, plant tissue will be preserved in silica gel, and fungal tissue will be frozen or lyophilized. Record the volume, concentration, and type of preservative/method of preservation used here

fields.label: date of preservation
fields.description: Date on which the species was preserved. Please use YYYY-MM-DD format

fields.label: sex
fields.description: sex of the organism from which the sample was obtained

fields.label: relationship
fields.description: indicates if the specimen has a known parental, child, or sibling relationship to any other specimens.

fields.label: symbiont
fields.description: Used to separate host and symbiont metadata within a symbiont system where the host species are indicated as 'N' and symbionts are indicated as 'Y'

fields.label: collecting institution
fields.description: Name of the institution to which the person collecting the specimen belongs. Format: Institute Name, Institute Address

fields.label: GAL
fields.description: the name (or acronym) of the genome acquisition lab responsible for the sample.
options: DNA Sequencing and Genomics Laboratory, Helsinki Genomics Core Facility
GIGA-Genomics Core Facility, University of Liege

fields.label: specimen voucher
fields.description: Unique identifier that references the physical specimen that remains after the sequence has been obtained and that ideally exists in a curated collection.

fields.label: GAL sample id
fields.description: unique name assigned to the sample by the genome acquisition lab.

fields.label: collector sample id
fields.description: unique name assigned to the sample by the COLLECTOR or COLLECTOR_AFFILIATION.

fields.label: specimen id
fields.description: Unique identifier used to link all data for the recorded specimen.

fields.label: tube or well id for barcoding
fields.description: This is either the well number on a plate (there are 96 wells per tissue plate) OR the barcode/unique identifier on the tube containing the tissue sample

fields.label: tissue voucher id for biobanking
fields.description: Accession number of frozen, biobanked material from the sequenced specimen. This ID should be prefixed by the name of the collection (e.g., ATCC:12345)

fields.label: dna voucher id for biobanking
fields.description: Accession number of DNA biobanked from the sequenced specimen. This ID should be prefixed by the name of the collection (e.g. ATCC:12345)

fields.label: specimen id risk
fields.description: indicate if there is any risk that the SPECIMEN_ID provided does not reflect a single genetic entity OR the species names it has been submitted under

fields.label: difficult or high priority sample
fields.description: species/samples that are difficult to collect (rare) or high priority to push through sequencing for any reason

fields.label: size of tissue in tube
fields.description: how large is the sample in the tube.

fields.label: tissue for barcoding
fields.description: what part of the organism was dissected for DNA barcoding (e.g. leg, soft-body tissue etc.). Muscle tissue is ideal for barcoding

fields.label: tissue removed from barcoding
fields.description: Instructions for appropriate Molecular Barcoding SOPs has to be arranged by the species ambassador with the Barcoding partner , noting that barcoding requires materials in specific tube or plate types.

fields.label: tissue for biobanking
fields.description: what part of the organism was dissected for biobanking (e.g. leg, soft-body tissue etc.)

fields.label: hazard group
fields.description: If the specimen needs to be processed in a containment level 1,2, or 3 lab

fields.label: regulatory compliance
fields.description: Note that ERGA will not be able to process further any samples where N is entered

fields.label: indigenous rights applicable
fields.description: Mandatory information upon if indigenious rights are applicable to the sample/the species the sample was derived from

fields.label: associated traditional knowledge applicable
fields.description: Mandatory information upon if indigenious rights are applicable to the sample/the species the sample was derived from

fields.label: ethics permits mandatory
fields.description: Mandatory information upon if an ethics permit is needed to sample/sequence/voucher/biobank the sample/the species the sample was derived from

fields.label: sampling permits mandatory
fields.description: Mandatory information upon if sampling permits are needed to sample/sequence/voucher/biobank the sample/the species the sample was derived from

fields.label: nagoya permits mandatory
fields.description: Mandatory information upon if a permit in compliance with the Nagoya Protocol on Access to Genetic Resources and the Fair and Equitable Sharing of Benefits Arising from their Utilization to the Convention on Biological Diversity is needed for the sample in question/the species the sample was derived from

fields.label: other informations
fields.description: further relevant information not captured by the other fields

fields.label: taxon remarks
fields.description: Free text to summarise any known issues with the mapping of TAXON_ID to SCIENTIFIC_NAME or add other taxon database identifiers here e.g.,EukRef. Here you can also comment on STRAIN availabilit

fields.label: infraspecific epithet
fields.description: Where the sample is from a formally named infraspecific taxon, give the infraspecific name here, with prefixes in the following format: ssp. (for subspecies), var. (for variety), cv. (for cultivar), br. (for breed)

fields.label: culture or strain id
fields.description: living, culturable, named laboratory strain that sequenced material is derived from.

fields.label: taxon ID
fields.description: The Taxon ID of the NCBI Taxonomy database, visit https://ena-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/faq/taxonomy_requests.html

fields.label: common name
fields.description: Vernacular name, if the species has one. If multiple names are required, separate names with a | (vertical pipe) character

fields.label: tube or well id
fields.description: This field should record the FluidX barcode for each tube in a rack (or each well in a plate, where relevant) if available, else the position of the well if submitted in a well plate or the label on the submitted tubes. If barcodes are entered, use a barcode scanner in advance of preparing samples to reduce errors, do not enter barcodes manually. IMPORTANT: this field will be the unique identifier to track the sample status when published
